Pulses removed from must-buy list: What’s new in the updated India-US trade deal factsheet
description: The US has revised its factsheet on the trade deal with India, notably removing any mention of pulses from the list of agricultural exports. Additionally, the language regarding India's commitment to purchasing American goods has shifted from a firm commitment to an intention to buy, impacting the description of proposed procurements.

description: February 11 brings three key T20 World Cup 2026 matches: Afghanistan vs South Africa, Australia vs Ireland, and England vs West Indies. Afghanistan aim to bounce back against a strong Proteas side, while Australia begin their campaign against upset-prone Ireland. England and West Indies, both two-time champions, clash in a high-profile encounter, with both teams in good recent form.

Warriors trade rumors: Grizzlies guard could boost 2026 playoff push
description: Golden State Warriors are eyeing veteran guard Eric Gordon from the buyout market to bolster their bench for the playoffs. Gordon, recently waived by Memphis, offers proven perimeter shooting and playoff experience. His potential low-cost signing could provide crucial spacing and veteran presence alongside Stephen Curry, enhancing the team's offensive depth without disrupting the core rotation.

title: UK: Teen arrested for stabbing two boys at London school
description: A 13-year-old suspect was arrested by UK police following a stabbing incident at Kingsbury High School in northwest London. Two boys, aged 12 and 13, were seriously injured and hospitalized. Counter-terrorism officers are leading the investigation into the attack, with the motive still under review.

title: K-pop, cartoons and online games: Ghaziabad sisters spent 20 hours a day on phone
description: Police investigating the alleged suicides of three sisters in Ghaziabad recovered data from a sold mobile phone, revealing extensive daily use for Korean content, cartoons, and gaming. The recovered material aligns with details mentioned in their suicide note, prompting authorities to seek a ban on specific games.

Tendulkar invites PM Modi, Rahul Gandhi for Arjun-Saaniya wedding ceremony
description: Sachin Tendulkar met Rahul Gandhi and invited him, along with President Droupadi Murmu, PM Narendra Modi and Amit Shah, to Arjun Tendulkar and Saaniya Chandok’s wedding. Arjun, now with Lucknow Super Giants, has had a mixed IPL career and represents Goa domestically. Saaniya is from the Graviss Group family and a longtime friend of the Tendulkars.

title: Rajnath-led council to discuss procurement of French Rafale jets this week, key nod likely

'Border 2' box office collection: Sunny Deol film surpasses Rs 426 crore globally
description: 'Border 2' is still captivating audiences on the big screen, celebrating 19 days of box office success with a current collection of Rs 2.84 crore. This gripping war drama, which leverages the excitement of the Republic Day holiday for a stellar debut, has already amassed an impressive Rs 314.59 crore in domestic earnings.

Delhi tragedy: Drunk labourer dies after falling into open sewer manhole in Rohini
description: A 30-year-old labourer tragically died after falling into an open sewer manhole in Delhi's Rohini area. The man, identified as Birju Kumar, was reportedly in an inebriated state when he lost his balance and fell into the approximately 14-foot-deep pit on Monday evening. Despite a rescue operation, he was recovered unconscious and later declared dead at a hospital.

title: Delhi Confidential: Say With A Song

After 'India players have superior bats' remark, Rajapaksa makes new post
description: Sri Lanka’s Bhanuka Rajapaksa clarified his controversial comments on Indian bats, saying his words were misunderstood and meant as praise, not an accusation of bat-tampering. He lauded India’s advanced cricket system and top bat manufacturers, admitting he should have given clearer context. His earlier remarks triggered online debate, but no ICC complaint was filed.

title: ‘Cannot be insulated from Parliamentary scrutiny’: Brittas writes to Birla, Radhakrishnan on PM CARES fund
Government confident it did better in battle of wits with opposition
description: Opposition's bid to remove the Speaker failed, exposing internal rifts as pragmatic voices pushed for legislative business. The government emerged stronger, refusing Congress's demands, while regional parties' desire for discussions on their concerns helped end the impasse. The Speaker stepped aside until the notice is addressed.

title: Joblessness among those aged 15 and above falls in rural, urban areas in Oct-Dec: PLFS
description: India's unemployment rate for those 15 and above in rural areas dropped to 4% in Oct-Dec 2025, down from 4.4% in the previous quarter. The overall Labour Force Participation Rate also saw a marginal increase to 55.8%, with female participation rising to 34.9%.

title: Top court refuses to direct disclosure of LoP’s dissent on Chief Information Commissioner appointment

Elderly woman dies, seven injured at temple procession in M.P.’s Gwalior
description: Deputy Inspector General of Police, Gwalior Range, said that of the seven injured, six are out of danger, while a woman who received serious injuries is currently under observation in Gwalior

title: Spurs vs Lakers injury report: Who’s playing, out and questionable
description: The San Antonio Spurs, riding a four-game winning streak and holding a strong position in the Western Conference, visit the Los Angeles Lakers. The Lakers are significantly hampered by multiple key player injuries, including LeBron James and Luka Dončić, impacting their depth and offensive capabilities. San Antonio, with a healthier roster, is favored to win.

title: Centre proposes spl NIA courts in 17 states, SC seeks their reply
description: Responding to Supreme Court's push, the Centre will establish at least one special court in 17 states for NIA terror cases. Each state will receive ₹1 crore for costs, with existing courts to be designated for these trials. This move aims to expedite justice for serious crimes, preventing prolonged detentions due to overloaded dockets.

title: SC seeks Centre’s report on action taken on its SC/ST sub-classification verdict

description: The draft DAP-2026 document has been uploaded on the website of the Defence Ministry, and it seeks comments or suggestions on it from various stakeholders

title: Niti Aayog seeks diesel vehicle phase-out, focus on cleaner tech
description: Niti Aayog has proposed a roadmap for India's transport sector to achieve net zero emissions by 2070. The strategy involves phasing out diesel vehicles and promoting cleaner technologies like CNG, hybrids, and electric vehicles. Stricter Corporate Average Fuel Efficiency (CAFE) norms will also be implemented to support this transition.

title: Only joint statement on US trade deal counts: Govt to House panel
‘Washing dirty linen in court’: HC tells kin of late industrialist Sunjay Kapur to go for mediation
description: The Delhi High Court urged the family of late industrialist Sunjay Kapur to pursue mediation to resolve their disputes, advising them not to let wealth become a curse. The court emphasized peaceful resolution and equitable sharing of assets, highlighting the founder's legacy. This comes amidst lawsuits concerning a family trust and a will.

title: West Bengal SIR final roll to now be published on Feb 28

PVV Infra signs tech partnership with Taiwan’s ITC Services Company
description: The company signed MoU for consultancy and technology transfer in solar cell manufacturing, Battery Energy Storage Systems, micro-inverters, and smart power electronics

title: ED summons Anil, Tina in Rs 40,000cr bank fraud case
description: The ED has issued fresh summonses to Anil Ambani and his wife Tina for questioning next week in connection with an alleged Rs 40,000 crore money laundering probe. The agency has already attached Rs 12,000 crore worth of assets. Tina Ambani's questioning is related to the purchase of a Manhattan apartment using alleged proceeds of crime.

title: Understand & respect India's UNSC 'membership aspirations': China

RCPL acquires T.N.’s Southern Health Foods for ₹156 crore

title: Any copies in circulation amount to copyright infringement, says Penguin
description: Rahul Gandhi continues to cite Gen M M Naravane's memoir, 'Four Stars of Destiny', despite publisher Penguin India stating it remains unpublished. Gandhi insists Naravane's own social media post confirms its availability, challenging Penguin's claim and suggesting a contradiction. The publisher maintains pre-orders do not constitute publication and warns of legal action against unauthorized circulation.

title: Chambal aqueduct set to facilitate water supply from river link project in Rajasthan
description: A new Chambal aqueduct in Rajasthan will enhance water supply for drinking and irrigation across 17 districts

title: Love, but no passage: What a killing changed for Meitei-Kuki couples
description: A brutal killing of a Meitei man visiting his Kuki fiancée in Churachandpur has shattered the fragile peace for inter-ethnic couples in Manipur.  The incident, captured on video, has reignited fear and deepened the divide, forcing many couples into renewed separation and uncertainty. Hopes for reconciliation are now stalled.

title: CPI, CPM move SC for FIR against Himanta over 'target-shooting' video
description: CPM and CPI have filed petitions in the Supreme Court seeking FIRs and an SIT probe against Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. The petitions cite alleged hate speeches and a recent video showing Sarma firing at an image of Muslim men, with accompanying phrases like 'no mercy'.

title: Delhi High Court nudges Kapur family towards mediation in trust case
description: Justice Mini Pushkarna, while hearing multiple applications in relation to the ongoing dispute, observed that “this is a very sorry state of affairs” and suggested the parties involved resolve the dispute in a peaceful manner

title: Government to launch upgraded scheme to promote girls’ education in April: Delhi CM Gupta
description: ‘Delhi Lakhpati Bitiya Yojana’ to replace ‘Delhi Ladli Scheme’ and provide increased greater financial assistance, says CM; ₹90 crore in dormant accounts disbursed, ₹100 crore more to be released soon

title: 3-hr takedown, AI labels: Govt cracks down on deepfakes
description: India has significantly tightened digital rules to combat deepfakes, mandating clear labelling and traceability for AI-generated content. Social media platforms now face stricter compliance, with reduced timelines for takedown of unlawful material and direct responsibility placed on senior officers. These new regulations aim to enhance user safety and accountability in the digital space.

title: Days ahead of elections, another Hindu man is killed in Bangladesh
description: A 62-year-old rice trader, Susen Chandra Sarkar, was brutally murdered in his shop in Mymensingh, Bangladesh, just days before the February 12 elections. Unidentified assailants hacked him to death and looted cash. This incident fuels fears among minority communities, with international groups warning of potential attacks.

title: Wajid Ali Shah was not exiled to Calcutta, he came on his own, says book by descendant
SC's gender handbook is too 'Harvard-oriented': CJI
description: Chief Justice Surya Kant criticized the Supreme Court's gender stereotype handbook as overly technical and inaccessible to common people and rape survivors. He emphasized the need for practical training for High Court judges on handling sexual assault cases. The bench set aside an insensitive Allahabad High Court ruling on an attempted rape case.

title: TaMo, long-time partner Stellantis ink fresh MoU

This partnership aims to leverage synergies and navigate evolving automotive megatrends like powertrain shifts and software-defined vehicles. The move signifies a strategic step for both global players in India's growing mobility sector.

The power couple's appearance at the star-studded event generated significant fan excitement and well wishes for their Hollywood venture.

title: UK-India FTA gets compared to ‘bag of soggy poppadums’ in House of Commons debate
description: UK MPs across parties criticized the UK-India FTA in the House of Commons, citing concerns over services, National Insurance evasion, delayed tariff reductions for British goods, and a lack of enforceable human rights clauses. Critics warned of cheap imports and the potential impact on British workers, particularly concerning the double contributions convention.

title: T.N. likely to become $150 billion electronics hub by 2030, says State Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa
description: He points out that the State’s share in India’s total electronics exports during FY2025 was around 41% at $15 billion, and this is likely to have increased to 45% in FY2026. He also expresses concern that the Centre has not yet released State-wise data on electronics exports for the current financial year

title: No bunkers built in border areas even 10 months after Op Sindoor
description: Bunker construction in Jammu and Kashmir border areas remains stalled nearly 10 months after heavy Pakistani shelling. Local MLAs highlight the urgent need for individual bunkers due to the scattered population. While over 500 bunkers are sanctioned for Uri, work is expected in April 2026. A proposal for 5,693 bunkers in Poonch is awaiting approval.

Over Rs 72,000 crore in unclaimed bank deposits transferred to RBI fund: Government
description: Over Rs 72,000 crore in unclaimed bank deposits, untouched for a decade, have been transferred to the RBI's Depositor Education and Awareness Fund. Public sector banks hold the largest portion. The government has launched UDGAM to help people trace their money and introduced measures to prevent further accumulation, aiming to boost financial literacy.

title: Family forced to carry body of relative home on two-wheeler in Andhra Pradesh as government hospital has no ambulance
description: When the impoverished family approached private auto drivers, they demanded up to ₹2,000 to transport the body. Collector says Bapatla Area Hospital did not have a hearse van as it did not qualify to have one based on mortality figures.

Penguin stated that any circulating copies are unauthorized and infringe copyright.

description: The Congress on Tuesday moved a no-confidence notice against Birla, accusing him of repeated partisan conduct during the ongoing Budget session. The party alleged that he denied leader of the opposition Rahul Gandhi the opportunity to speak and ordered the suspension of opposition MPs. Sources told news agency ANI that opposition MPs alleged "blatantly partisan" conduct and that leaders of Opposition parties were not allowed to speak.

M.G. Ramachandran’s hospitalisation in the U.S. and homecoming after treatment
description: MGR was flown to America on November 6, 1984, on a chartered Air India flight and was admitted to the Downstate Medical Centre in Brooklyn, New York. At the time of admission, he was not fully conscious after suffering a stroke. Later, he underwent a kidney transplant surgery at the hospital.

title: Global warming, pollution are stripping vibrant colours from nature
description: Climate change is draining colour from nature, from greener seas to browning forests and whitening coral reefs. As habitats become warmer and more more polluted, insects and birds are shifting pigmentation, changing the way they adapt to their surroundings, the way they tolerate heat, and even how successfully they mate

title: Why India needs political change to retain women in STEM
description: Gender diversity widens the range of questions that the scientific enterprise treats as legitimate and the social problems it deems worth solving

title: 'Not going to be easy': Sourav Ganguly warns Pakistan in high-stakes World Cup showdown
description: Former captain Sourav Ganguly expressed his enthusiasm for India's upcoming T20 World Cup encounter against Pakistan on February 15. He believes India, a strong team, will pose a significant challenge. Ganguly also highlighted his admiration for Abhishek Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah, Suryakumar Yadav, and Ishan Kishan within the current squad, noting the tournament's exciting start.

title: Sam Altman's advice to employees and investors: Here's what he said
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman reports renewed momentum, with ChatGPT exceeding 10% monthly growth and over 800 million weekly users. The company is also launching an updated chat model and sees "insane" 50% weekly growth in its Codex coding product.

title: Microsoft appoints its first 'Engineering Quality Head,' and here's why that matters
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella appointed Charlie Bell as the new head of engineering quality, a move occurring as AI-generated code increases alongside reported bugs. This comes amid challenges with Windows 11 reliability and underwhelming Copilot adoption, raising questions about the company's AI strategy and product quality.

title: SpaceX delays Mars mission, Musk says: ‘It is only possible to travel to Mars when …’
description: SpaceX is shifting its near-term focus from Mars to establishing a self-sustaining city on the Moon, citing faster timelines and more frequent launch opportunities. Elon Musk stated a Moon city could be achieved in under 10 years, while Mars would take over two decades.

title: Can a common hospital gas help fight drug-resistant pneumonia?
description: Researchers report that high-dose inhaled nitric oxide reduced the levels of drug-resistant bacteria in a large-animal ICU model and proved safe in early human testing; questions remain, however, about the method’s long-term benefits and feasibility
